annotation: <history><entry><input>ssh user@ubuntu-vm</input><output>Welcome to Ubuntu 22.04 LTS</output><annotation>Connecting to an Ubuntu 22.04 virtual machine via SSH.</annotation></entry><entry><input>lsb_release -a</input><output>Distributor ID: Ubuntu Description:    Ubuntu 22.04 LTS Release:        22.04 Codename:       jammy</output><annotation>Checking the version and codename of the Ubuntu distribution using `lsb_release`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt update</input><output>Get:1 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu jammy InRelease [270 kB] ... Fetched 270 kB in 1s (498 kB/s) Reading package lists... Done</output><annotation>Updating the package index using `apt update`.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt install -y curl</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree       Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: ca-certificates ...</output><annotation>Installing `curl` using `apt` to enable web requests from the terminal.</annotation></entry><entry><input>curl --version</input><output>curl 7.81.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.81.0 OpenSSL/1.1.1l zlib/1.2.11</output><annotation>Verifying the installation of `curl` by checking its version.</annotation></entry><entry><input>curl https://www.example.com</input><output>curl: (6) Could not resolve host: www.example.com</output><annotation>Attempting to make a web request using `curl`, but encountering a DNS resolution error.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo systemctl restart systemd-resolved</input><output></output><annotation>Restarting the DNS resolver service to resolve the issue.</annotation></entry><entry><input>curl https://www.example.com</input><output><!doctype html> ...</output><annotation>Successfully making a request to the website after restarting the DNS service.</annotation></entry><entry><input>sudo apt install -y git</input><output>Reading package lists... Done Building dependency tree       Reading state information... Done The following additional packages will be installed: git-man libc6-dev ...</output><annotation>Installing `git` using `apt` to manage version control.</annotation></entry><entry><input>git --version</input><output>git version 2.34.1</output><annotation>Verifying the installation of `git` by checking its version.</annotation></entry><entry><input>exit</input><output></output><annotation>Exiting the SSH session after completing the tasks.</annotation></entry></history>
